Posts.Title: Port placement Love83 christina0001

Posts.Content: Nov 29, 2018 02:56PM Love83 wrote: I now have my port was nervous as heck. But they gave me some good drugs. When I woke up "I said are we going to put me asleep" he replied " we are finished" I was amazed but must say I woke up stiff and feel moderate pain using Ibuprofen and and oxi to help with the discomfort. But other wise not to bad. If you don't mind me asking how old are you and what is your diagnoses? What chemotherapy will you he doing and for how long? Me I'm 35 was diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma, grade 3, stage 2 will have to do AC+T. Four rounds of AC, so once every two weeks. And then have to do T (taxol) for 12 weeks, once a week.
